alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Vernon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:28PM CDT until July 23 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN VERNON AND SOUTHEASTERN MONROE COUNTIES... At 428 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles west of New Lisbon to Elroy to 6 miles south of Wonewoc, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Vernon and southeastern Monroe Counties, including the following locations... Rockton, Wildcat Mountain State Park, Bartons Corners, Clifton, Highway 131 And County A, Avalanche and Glendale. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
